title: Historical Linguistics (Oxford Introduction to Language Study Series)
features: This book outlines the major issues and terminology used in the field of historical linguistics. Central issues of historical linguistics are addressed, including change, reconstruction of older languages, language birth and death, and relationships among languages.
description: '... accessible, and full of specific examples for added clarity.' - EL Gazette

Professor Henry Widdowson is Emeritus Professor of Education, University of London, and has also been Professor of Applied Linguistics at Essex University and Professor of English Linguistics at the University of Vienna.
store: Herbert Schendl (Author),  H. G. Widdowson (Series Editor)
